results.title: Oral intake of bucillamine, carvedilol, metformin, or phenformin does not protect against UVR-induced squamous cell carcinomas in hairless mice.
results.text_hl: No change in @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumour@@@ development was observed in the four repurposed drug groups compared to the UV control group, whereas @CHEMICAL_Niacinamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009536 @@@nicotinamide@@@ significantly reduced @DISEASE_Carcinogenesis @DISEASE_MESH:D063646 @@@carcinogenesis@@@ (P = 0.00012). @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment significantly reduced UVR-induced @<m>DISEASE_Erythema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004890 @@@erythema@@@ (P = 0.012), @CHEMICAL_bucillamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026535 @@@bucillamine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Phenformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010629 @@@phenformin@@@ increased dorsal @DISEASE_Pigmentation_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D010859 @@@pigmentation@@@ (P = 0.0013, and P = 0.0005), but no other photoprotective effect was observed across the repurposed groups.

citations.NLM: Pihl C, Bjerring P, Andersen F, Haedersdal M, Lerche CM. Oral intake of bucillamine, carvedilol, metformin, or phenformin does not protect against UVR-induced squamous cell carcinomas in hairless mice. Photochem Photobiol Sci. 2024 Feb 9;():. PMID: 38337129
citations.BibTeX: @article{38337129, title={Oral intake of bucillamine, carvedilol, metformin, or phenformin does not protect against UVR-induced squamous cell carcinomas in hairless mice.}, author={Pihl C and Bjerring P and Andersen F and Haedersdal M and Lerche CM}, journal={Photochem Photobiol Sci}}

results.title: Fixed Drug Eruption Secondary to Four Anti-diabetic Medications: An Unusual Case of Polysensitivity
results.text_hl: It was accompanied by the appearance of @DISEASE_Blister @DISEASE_MESH:D001768 @@@blisters@@@, ulcerations, and @<m>DISEASE_Erythema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004890 @@@erythema@@@ (Figure 1). This was two weeks after the initiation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Al Masri D, Fleifel M, Hirbli K. Fixed Drug Eruption Secondary to Four Anti-diabetic Medications: An Unusual Case of Polysensitivity Cureus. 2021 Oct;13(10):e18599. PMID: 34786218
citations.BibTeX: @article{34786218, title={Fixed Drug Eruption Secondary to Four Anti-diabetic Medications: An Unusual Case of Polysensitivity}, author={Al Masri D and Fleifel M and Hirbli K}, journal={Cureus}, volume={13}, number={10}, pages={e18599}}

results.title: Randomized Placebo Control Study of Metformin in Psoriasis Patients with Metabolic Syndrome (Systemic Treatment Cohort)
results.text_hl: Intergroup comparisons for mean percentage change in PASI, ESI, and PGA scores at 12 weeks from baseline carried out by Student's t test. *@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ versus placebo, PASI: @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@Psoriasis@@@ area severity index, ESI: @<m>DISEASE_Erythema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004890 @@@Erythema@@@, scaling, and induration, PGA: Physician global assessment

citations.NLM: Singh S, Bhansali A. Randomized Placebo Control Study of Metformin in Psoriasis Patients with Metabolic Syndrome (Systemic Treatment Cohort) Indian J Endocrinol Metab. 2017 Jul-Aug;21(4):581-587. PMID: 28670544
citations.BibTeX: @article{28670544, title={Randomized Placebo Control Study of Metformin in Psoriasis Patients with Metabolic Syndrome (Systemic Treatment Cohort)}, author={Singh S and Bhansali A}, journal={Indian J Endocrinol Metab}, volume={21}, number={4}, pages={581-587}}

results.title: Randomized placebo control study of insulin sensitizers (Metformin and Pioglitazone) in psoriasis patients with metabolic syndrome (Topical Treatment Cohort)
results.text_hl: Statistically significant improvement was observed in @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@Psoriasis@@@ Area and Severity Index (PASI), @<m>DISEASE_Erythema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004890 @@@Erythema@@@, Scaling and Induration (ESI) and Physician global assessment (PGA) scores in @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@ (p values - PASI = 0.001, ESI = 0.002, PGA = 0.008) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ groups (p values - PASI = 0.001, ESI = 0.016, PGA = 0.012) as compared to placebo.

citations.NLM: Singh S, Bhansali A. Randomized placebo control study of insulin sensitizers (Metformin and Pioglitazone) in psoriasis patients with metabolic syndrome (Topical Treatment Cohort) BMC Dermatol. 2016 Aug 17;16(1):12. PMID: 27531132
citations.BibTeX: @article{27531132, title={Randomized placebo control study of insulin sensitizers (Metformin and Pioglitazone) in psoriasis patients with metabolic syndrome (Topical Treatment Cohort)}, author={Singh S and Bhansali A}, journal={BMC Dermatol}, volume={16}, number={1}, pages={12}}
